text: "Midnight Magic Man" is a song written by Neil Levenson and Hank Hunter. It was covered by a couple of groups before it was a top 20 hit for singer Nash Chase in 1973. ==Background== The song was written by Neil Levenson and Hank Hunter, aka Henry Hadad, Jr.Catalog of Copyright Entries: Third series Pahe 505 1971 It was recorded by Franklyn Circle in 1971, and was released on Laurie Records.45cat Franklyn Circle - DiscographyPopular & rock records, 1948-1978, Jerry Osborne Page 87 Also in 1971, it appeared on the B side of Triangle's "Judge And Jury", released on Paramount Records.45cat Triangle (Paramount) - DiscographyPopular & rock records, 1948-1978, Jerry Osborne Page 214 ===Nash Chase recording=== The single backed with "Fantasy" was released on the HMV label in 1972.45cat Nash Chase - Discography It was then released by Columbia.Sergent.com.au Nash Chase The A side was written by Hunter, Levenson, and produced by Mike Le Petit. The B side "Fantasy" was written by Michael Hoeta.45cat Nash Chase - DiscographyNational Library of New Zealand Midnight magic man (sound recording) / Hunter, Levenson ; (performed by Nash Chase. Fantasy / M. Hoeta ; (performed by) Nash Chase. It registered at no 20 in the N.Z. charts on April 2, 1973. BY April 16, 1973, it was at no 18.Hits of all Decades New Zealand's Weekly (NZ listener) Single Charts From 1973, New Zealand's (NZ listener charts) Single Chart for April 2,1973Hits of all Decades New Zealand's Weekly (NZ listener) Single Charts From 1973, New Zealand's (NZ listener charts) Single Chart for It had moved up one notch from the previous weeks position of 19.
